Klopp: "A centre-half for a top team is playing with a lot of space at the back. That’s how Tottenham, City and sometimes how Arsenal act."

Klopp: "You have to involve a lot of players in offensive things usually, that is why counter-pressing is a pretty useful skill."

Klopp: "I saw a lot of centre-halves. We cannot go for a centre-half from Bayern Munich, for example – they have similar problems to us."

Klopp: "But you have to imagine how a defender will react. All clubs defend in some moments high. It is about being football smart."

Klopp: "We have had a lot of physical games in the last few weeks with a lot of challenges and we know we need to be ready for this game."

Klopp: "I do not feel fear – not one second so far. I think the last game in the last few minutes yes, but that was not about the top four."

Klopp: "If you look at the points everything is good, if you look at the number of games played it is like, ‘oh’. It is not like it looks."

Klopp: "No team of the teams we fight for top four can win all games. They play against each other. Why should we think about it too much?"
